page.title: 02 THE MALTINGS
page.content: Since 1975 the Farnham Maltings has become an arts and community centre but its history dates back to the 18th century. The earliest surviving documents, dated 1729, show that the building was used as a tannery. In 1830,a maltster set up business in the east wing. The tanyard was sold in 1845 for Â£1400 and converted into a brewery.The whole property was bought, by the Lion Brewery,in 1899 and became a maltings.Courages bought the property in 1925 and continued malting there until 1956. The building stood empty for 12 years then plans were put forward to demolish and redevelop the site. The Chairman of the Farnham Society proposed converting it into a community centre.Courages offered the property to the town for Â£30000. The project was approved and money raised for the purchase in March 1969.
